bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Commission
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District } ss

Be at remmembered that on this first day of May AD 1885 before be James G Swan a Commissiones of the District Court of this Unites States in and for said district personally came Tokvat or Billy. Kleachton a Annie and Frank a Banllett who acknowledge the custody to one and be indebted to the United States of America in the full and just sworn of fifty dollars to be loved on their goods chattls lands and tenomands and the United States under of defendants be made in the conditions following.

The coditions of this remmand are such that if this attraction Tokvat and Kleachton shall personally appear before the United States District Court Fourth 3rd Judicial District building terms at Port Townsend at the martinterm thereof on the first day of said there to be begon and holdon on the forthwith someday of Agust AD 1885 in said district then and there to testify on behalf of the United States in a cause where in the said United States is plaintiff and Leonard Martin is defendant and shall notify anytime be absent or depart from said court wihtout leave than this very to be void otherwise to remain in full force and virtue

In teritorry where of the otligns have
set their hands and seals the day and year other within
Tokvat his mark Billy Kleachton his mark Annie Frank A Barktell.
Legend sealed and acknowledge before me this first day of May AD 1885
James G Swan US Commision & Judicial District Washington Territory
No506 US Commissions Court James G Sworn Comsision United States vs Leonard Martin} Selling Whiskey vs Indians
Recognianco et Witnesses Tokvat a Billey Indians Kleachton or Ammie Witness Frank A Barkell discout arrested Fifty dollars James G Sworn US Commision 3rd Judicial Dist WT
Commisions fee appions felon & accept brad 50 10 60
